Name: Daiquiri No. 4
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
2 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water) optional
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Garnish with lime wedge on rim.
Review: Maraschino cherry liqueur adds delicate notes to this finely balanced golden rum-based Daiquiri.
History: Created by Constantino "Constante" Ribalaïgua Vert, who bartended at Havana's famous El Floridita (originally Bar Florida) from circa 1914 to his death in 1952. (He purchased the bar in 1918.) This is the fourth of four numbered daiquiris in the 1934 1st edition Bar La Florida Cocktails menu book from his bar.
Nutrition: One serving of Daiquiri No. 4 contains 175 calories
